Available after 5PM, our private parking lot is located at , a short walk from the restaurant. Please note, that availability is limited and not guaranteed.Additional parking can be found via street meter parking or the King & Queen Parking Garage, 85 Queen St Charleston, SC 29401. 101 Broad Street, Charleston SC 29401 Get Directions Reservations Email Signup Email Signup Please, enter a valid first name First Name - Required Please, enter a valid last name Last Name - Required Please, enter a valid email Email - Required Submit Please check errors in the form above Thank you for signing up for email updates! Home Main content starts here, tab to start navigating Slide 1 of 5 Slide 2 of 5 Slide 3 of 5 Slide 4 of 5 Slide 5 of 5 hero gallery paused, press to play images slides Playing hero gallery, press to pause images slides SI ACCOMODI SOUTHERN ITALY MEETS SOUTHERN HOSPITALITY at Sorelle, a dining destination like no other on Charleston’s storied Broad Street. Inspired by Italy’s all-day cafes, abundant markets and rich culinary traditions, Sorelle features a mercato, central bar, wine room, and a grand dining room offering a variety of experiences for every food lover. Our Story Mangiamo Helmed by Chef Nick Dugan, Sorelle's kitchen offers a modern spin on classic Southern Italian cuisine made with Lowcountry ingredients, from fresh pastas and wood-fired pizzas to refined seafood dishes. Inspired by Italy’s convivial drinking culture, the cocktail and wine menus feature an extensive collection of Italian spirits and wines that celebrate the diverse regions of the country. Menus Private Dining Sorelle’s 3rd-floor private dining area offers an intimate experience with a touch of luxury. Designed by Meyer Davis Studios, the interior boasts a ten-person, round, marble dining table with comfortable velvet chairs, a billiards table, and a relaxing lounge area. Private Dining Room: (10 seated or 25 standing reception) Full Restaurant Buyout: (60 seated) Learn More Follow Us @sorelle_chs | 88 BROAD ST (843) 974-1575 Reservations Email Signup Email Signup Please, enter a valid first name First Name - Required Please, enter a valid last name Last Name - Required Please, enter a valid email Email - Required Submit Please check errors in the form above Thank you for signing up for email updates! Decaf Peppermint, Decaf Chamomile 6 $ MATCHA GREEN TEA LATTE 8 $ MASALA CHAI LATTE 8 $ ASSAM ICED TEA 4.50 $ Fresh Juice ORANGE 7 $ GRAPEFRUIT 7 $ Dolce Zeppole e ‘Caffè Vanilla Bean Sugar Doughnuts, Marsala Zabaglione, Mocha 16 $ Limone Whipped Ricotta, Coosaw Farms Blueberry, Graham Cracker Crumbs 17 $ Budino Di Cioccolato Chocolate Custard, Hazelnut, Candied Orange, Soft-Whipped Cream 16 $ Sorelle Affogato Brown Sugar Gelato, Cocoa Nib, LaMill Espresso 14 $ Mascarpone Semifreddo Pistachio Sponge, Strawberry-Basil Sorbet, Honey Tuile 15 $ Olive Oil Torta Warm Olive Oil Cake, Almond Sorbet, Salted Caramel 15 $ Apertivo MARTINI TAVOLATA Nonna’s Secret Recipe featuring Grey Goose Vodka 18 $ LA BEFANA Domaine de Canton, Pear Eau de Vie, Apple Syrup, Prosecco, Thyme 16 $ GARDEN VARIETY Ginger Canton with Pear Brandy, White Port, Lemon & Bay Laurel 16 $ GARIBALDI A must-have blend of Campari & fresh, fluffy Orange Juice 16 $ intermezzo ROSETTA Wonderbird Gin & Rinomato Bianco shaken with Lavender Simple Syrup & Egg White Foam 18 $ SORRENTO SUN Ilegal Mezcal, Luxardo Bianco shaken with Lime, Passion Fruit & Carrot 18 $ FINALE PAGLIACCI OLD FASHIONED Russell’s 6-year Rye, See Elephant Amaro, Orange & Aromatic Bitters 18 $ SORELLE NEGRONI Hendrick’s Gin, Campari, Mirto, Carpano Classico & Coconut Essence 18 $ La Dolce Vita ESPRESSO MARTINI Grey Goose Vodka, Borghetti Italian Coffee, LAMILL Espresso, Vanilla Bean Teecino 16 $ Zero Proof SORELLE ITALIAN SODA Vanilla Cream Soda & Whipped Cream 10 $ ST. AGRESTIS ‘PHONY NEGRONI’ Bittersweet, Bubbly & Served Tall 10 $ FEVER TREE Ginger Ale, Ginger Beer, or Mediterranean Tonic 8 $ Beer BIRRA LUCANA Lager, Italy 8 $ FATTY’S Italian Pilsner, Charleston, SC 9 $ EDMUND’S OAST Seasonal Sour, Charleston, SC 10 $ Revelry ‘Poke the Bear’ American Pale Ale Charleston, SC 9 $ Untitled Art Non-Alcoholic Lager 9 $ Sorelle takes pride in its rotating selection of more than 300 wines that celebrate the finest from Italy and with something for every taste. The program emphasizes wines from Northern and Central Italy, showcasing both well-known and highly acclaimed producers, as well as lesser known producers for guests to discover. Sorelle’s wine list also features several “verticals” of iconic wines, including some dating back to the 1980s. In addition to benchmark wines from renowned wine regions such as Champagne, Bordeaux, and Burgundy, Sorelle’s wine list includes a unique selection dedicated to wines made outside of Italy using Italian varietals. Wines from California, Washington, Australia, and Argentina can also be found on the curated list. Guests may browse the wine list before your next visit using the button below. Corkage Fee $50 each for the first two 750ml bottles, $100 for the 3rd bottle. 3 bottle maximum. Main content starts here, tab to start navigating Weekly Mercato Specials Slide 1 of 2 Slide 2 of 2 hero gallery paused, press to play images slides Playing hero gallery, press to pause images slides A new reason to visit the mercato each week. Every Saturday, we introduce a weekly drink and panino special, crafted with seasonal ingredients and inspired by Italian flavors. These limited-time offerings bring a fresh twist to your favorites—stop by to see what’s new and savor the flavors of the moment or follow along on our . AGRESTIS ‘PHONY NEGRONI’ Bittersweet, Bubbly & Served Tall 10 $ FEVER TREE Ginger Ale, Ginger Beer, or Mediterranean Tonic 8 $ Beer BIRRA LUCANA Lager, Italy 8 $ FATTY’S Italian Pilsner, Charleston, SC 9 $ EDMUND’S OAST Seasonal Sour, Charleston, SC 10 $ Revelry ‘Poke the Bear’ American Pale Ale Charleston, SC 9 $ Untitled Art Non-Alcoholic Lager 9 $ Sorelle takes pride in its rotating selection of more than 300 wines that celebrate the finest from Italy and with something for every taste. The program emphasizes wines from Northern and Central Italy, showcasing both well-known and highly acclaimed producers, as well as lesser known producers for guests to discover. Sorelle’s wine list also features several “verticals” of iconic wines, including some dating back to the 1980s. In addition to benchmark wines from renowned wine regions such as Champagne, Bordeaux, and Burgundy, Sorelle’s wine list includes a unique selection dedicated to wines made outside of Italy using Italian varietals. Wines from California, Washington, Australia, and Argentina can also be found on the curated list. Guests may browse the wine list before your next visit using the button below. Corkage Fee $50 each for the first two 750ml bottles, $100 for the 3rd bottle. 3 bottle maximum.
